titleInfo.title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-12-06 - Part 2

mods.accessCondition: This audio file is the property of the Country Music Hall of Fame® and Museum and may be protected by U.S. and international copyright laws. To inquire about use permissions and obtain a high-quality version of this, contact audio@countrymusichalloffame.org. Please cite audio file information in email.
mods.abstract: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 6, 1958. This show celebrates the 1000th network broadcast of the Prince Albert Grand Ole Opry, featuring Grant Turner (announcer), and performances by Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys, Pee Wee King with Tommy Jackson, the Fruit Jar Drinkers, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, the Old Hickory Singers, and Marty Robbins. Also features recorded messages from Roy Acuff, Red Foley, and Tennessee Ernie Ford, and an excerpt of a Hank Williams recording. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
